Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 4th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1968...
Injured on 7/20/1968 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for one week...
Earned first career win on 5/11/1969...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 10/1/1969, going 3-0, 0.00...
Had first career hit on 4/16/1970, off Mel Martin (PG)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/1/1972, off Raymond Satterwhite (Min)...
Won Player of the Week award on 10/6/1972, winning 2 games with a 1.76 ERA...
Injured on 5/3/1974 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Was selected to the 1974 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/28/1974 with a Bone Chips Elbow, out for 7 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 10/6/1976, winning 2 games with a 1.20 ERA...
Injured on 5/7/1980 with a Strained Bicep Muscle, out for 5-6 weeks...
Drove in 6 runs against Manchester on 4/1/1981...
Traded from New Jersey to Capital City on 7/30/1985 (Going to CC: P B. Clatterbuck. Going to NJ: CF J. Baugh)...
Signed as a free agent by Lynchburg on 5/12/1986 to a 1-year deal worth $1,264,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Capital City on 2/1/1987 to a 2-year deal worth $2,471,700 per year...
